data.title: Greek heaven
data.text: Only Greek restaurant in Great Falls and very reasonable prices. Small family operated business - not corporate or chain. Delicious food and they also sale some greek staples. You won't be disappointed.

data.title: Very good
data.text: Very  good! not as good as the Gyros place in Missoula but very good and great service. Find it in the mall!

data.title: Disappointing stale Greek style food in failing Great Falls indoor mall
data.text:
With a nice recommendation from our AAA guide,  we found this food court stall in a dying mall in Great Falls. There were no customers in the restaurant or in the mall  at 6:30PM  The AAA guide emphasized the freshness of Little Athens as not a fast food restaurant. 
 The menu had standards for Greek fast food but nothing was fresh after all. We asked the clerk   The Pastistia is made once a month and stored to be reheated  So too about the other entrees. Nothing is prepared daily here. Steering to the classic Gyro,  the sandwich was a sparsely filled small pita with unrecogniuzable dried out slices of cold something ( not gyro meat!) ,watery sauce not yogurt and no feta.  Disgusting  and nothing like  a gyro.  This was not finished but pitched in the trash. 
Ordering the largest /most expensive soda offered from the fountain machine we were surprised that with no customers there would be a charge for topping off or for a refill. 
Disappointed and still hungry we walked away through this mall with empty  stores and no customers.
 AAA needs to send its inspector back or find out if its review  was written by a relative!

data.title: Good Food Great People
data.text: Delicious greek delights.  Try one of everything.  The family is so friendly and kind.  They also have a selection of grocery items that are often hard to find in little town grocery stores.  Check this little gem out!

data.title: Like Greece
data.text: Enjoy the Gyros and how much it reminds me of vacations in Greece. They have changed things s bit since my last visit but they were quick. A bit too much dressing for my liking.

data.title: Going downhill
data.text: We've been visiting this restaurant in the mall for years - but probably not again.  On Saturday at prime lunch time, there were only two men working - one was at the register and one was cooking trying to keep up with the orders coming in.  I could not believe it when we saw the cashier walk over to the food station and start helping to get the food out without washing his hands before touching the food.  We then noticed that neither of the men had gloves on - they were handling the food with their bare hands!  After a few moments, the line built up again for ordering and the other man who had been cooking walked over, took their orders and their money and again - he walked back to the stove without washing his hands either and started plating up food and using his bare hands to put globs of lettuce, etc. on the gyros.  We couldn't even eat our food when we got it - that is so, so against any and all rules regarding food handling.  Touching all that money and then putting your hands in the food you are serving?  YUCK!  They usually had several workers behind the counter cooking and cashiering - so I don't know what is happening, but it was not sanitary or healthy.

data.title: Not bad
data.text: The meat in wrap is substantial but dressing sauce is too salty. Overall it deserves a $10 to have a quick lunch. The store is a little hard to find since it is actually inside a mall.

data.title: Good Greek Food inside a mall,  Who knew?
data.text: It was fun to see the meat being cut off the pole for our Gyro's.  If you order the baklava, be sure to get the 'homemade' version.  It is made with real honey and the other has corn syrup.

data.title: Great gyros, especially for a mall setting!
data.text: My husband and I lived in Great Falls, MT 20 years ago and used to frequent (and loved) Little Athens.  So we were really pleased to find that it was still here and still serving such wonderful gyros!

data.title: Always Love the Gyro Joint
data.text: When we find ourselves in Great Falls, Little Athens is often a stop for us.  They have been in Business, owned by the same family, for as long  (and that, unfortunately, is a long time) as I can remember.  I think the man and wife who started it came from Greece.  The food is always great,  There is not a lot to choose from, but top off a Gyro with one of their desserts,  Baklava, for instance, and you will leave with the satisfied feeling of having had one of the best fast food meals you can get.  Gyros are so healthy, the dessert almost is mandatory.

data.title: Opah !
data.text: Get the gyros for sure. Probably skip the souvlaki. The desserts are almost always good. I think the tzaziki sauce could use more garlic. All in all not a bad Saturday afternoon gut bomb when shopping.

data.title: Best Lunch in Great Falls
data.text: In town a couple times a year and this place is always what we have for lunch. Great food and home made desserts! Don't be afraid of the authentic look of this spot, you will be disappointed if you do. Whatever you do don't settle for Subway across the way! This place is legit.

data.title: Great food in humble surroundings
data.text: The gyros are fantastic, with excellent tzatziki sauce. The baklava is great too, and they have other fancy desserts that look tasty in the display, but I haven't tried them yet. The restaurant is in a mall, with typical mall decor, but the food makes it worthwhile.

data.title: Good Giros
data.text: This place is well hidden in the Holiday Village mall.  You have to look to find it, but worth the effort.

data.title: My Recent Visit To Little Athens Cafe.
data.text: I ordered a Giro,Asked about some other products and The Giro was delicious! The information I received on My questions was answered... Nice People. Nice Café...

data.title: home made baklava excellent
data.text: Last year we had an excellent experience here, the food was great, but this year we went late and we had the feeling they used left over meat and too much sauce, but the home made baklava was more than excellent.

data.title: Great Food
data.text: We love Little Athens.  Great gyros, best French fries in town and probably the best homemade baklava anywhere.  Better than what I've had in Europe or the middle east.

data.title: very good
data.text: The very best Gyro in the State. Help is young and careless sometimes but the food keeps me coming back.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: I have no complaints about this place. Good baklava and the only place to get a good gyro besides the state fair. The only downside is that they only take cash. Something many people don't carry around. They would get a lot more business if they took cards.

data.title: Gyros in an otherwise limited cultural town
data.text: Being placed inside a mall foodcourt in an otherwise limited cultural city notwithstanding, the food and reprieve were much needed.  After spending a portion of the holiday season shopping in the in-laws hometown and actually going to a mall for the first time in 15 years, observing American spending and instant gratification at its finest, a Gyro with meat cut right off the spit was what I needed.  Food was great; however they do not take credit cards (which I found in more than one establishment in Great Falls) as the town is still in the 1950s--which adds to the charm of a few days there.
